page.title: 13ARCHITECTURE IN BRILL.
page.content: In Brill many of the houses are old and brick built with clay tiled roofs and date from the 18th and early 19th century.The Manor House is from the 16th century.Waterloo house and some others next to the Sun Hotel have slate roofs.There are also some newer developments.The council has houses in Temple Street built in 1936,Brae Hill and Brae Hill Close built in 1953-54, The Firs from 1962 and most recently, Clarke's Field Close built in 1977.The major private developments are at the far end of Windmill Street built in 1969,High Land Close and the adjacent houses in Windmill Street in 1971 and The Lawns which is still under construction together with its access road.Brill has now been declared a conservation area so Therefore any further developments within its boundary will be strictly limited.
